org.js4ms.io.channel

Class OutputChannelMap<MessageType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.js4ms.io.channel.OutputChannelMap<MessageType>
  • Type Parameters:
    MessageType - The message object type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageOutput<MessageType>, OutputChannel<MessageType>

    public final class OutputChannelMap<MessageType>
extends Object
implements OutputChannel<MessageType>
    An output channel that forwards a message to one output channel out of a set of one or more output channels based on a key value extracted from the message. The channel map only allows one channel per key value. A channel added previously can be replaced by adding a different channel using the same key value. A thread should not attempt to add or remove channels while executing in the send(Object, int) method as this may result in an exception.
    Author:
    Greg Bumgardner (gbumgard)
    See Also:
    MessageKeyExtractor

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.js4ms.io.channel.MessageOutput

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OutputChannelMap(MessageKeyExtractor<MessageType> keyExtractor)
      Constructs an output channel map that uses the specified MessageKeyExtractor to retrieve the key value from each message that will be used to select which output channel will receive the message.

      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty()
        Indicates whether the map contains any channels.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of true indicates that no output channels are currently mapped and false indicates that one or more channels are currently mapped.

      • send

        public final void send(MessageType message,
        int milliseconds)
                throws IOException,
                       InterruptedIOException,
                       InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: MessageOutput
        Attempts to send a message to a message sink within a specified amount of time.

        Some channel implementations may choose to accept the static object EOM to indicate that the caller has stopped producing messages.

        Specified by:
        send in interface MessageOutput<MessageType>
        Parameters:
        message - A MessageType object or the static object EOM (if supported).
        milliseconds - The amount of time allotted to complete the operation.
        Throws:
        IOException - The send operation has failed.
        InterruptedIOException - The send operation was interrupted or timed out.
        InterruptedException - The calling thread was interrupted before the send operation could complete.
